timeline.bodyText: We count FNI completed not for the process itself. I guess that we want to do the same for FNI terminated.
timeline.author: saig0

timeline.bodyText:
Is there a difference between two counters and add a label for the type (completed|terminated)?
Looking at the dashboard, I think it would make sense to merge the two views together into one.
timeline.author: saig0
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright Camunda Services GmbH and/or licensed to Camunda Services GmbH under
+ * one or more contributor license agreements. See the NOTICE file distributed
+ * with this work for additional information regarding copyright ownership.
+ * Licensed under the Zeebe Community License 1.0. You may not use this file
+ * except in compliance with the Zeebe Community License 1.0.
+ */
+package io.zeebe.broker.exporter.metrics;
+
+import io.prometheus.client.Counter;
+
+public class FNIMetrics {
+
+  private static final Counter FLOW_NODE_INSTANCE_COMPLETED =
+      Counter.build()
+          .namespace("zeebe")
+          .name("flow_node_instance_completed")
+          .help("Number of flow node instances, which have been completed.")
+          .labelNames("partition")
+          .register();
+
+  private static final Counter FLOW_NODE_INSTANCE_TERMINATED =
+      Counter.build()
+          .namespace("zeebe")
+          .name("flow_node_instance_terminated")
+          .help("Number of flow node instances, which have been terminated.")
+          .labelNames("partition")
+          .register();

replies.bodyText: I think it makes sense to change that to labels. https://www.innoq.com/en/blog/prometheus-counters/
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.message:
chore(broker): add fni metrics

 Add flow node instance metrics to the build-in MetricExporter
 FNI's are counted for ELEMENT_COMPLETED and ELEMENT_TERMINATED.
